caption.p: Genome organization of SARS-CoV-2 and its comparison with other coronaviruses. The coding regions of beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 Wuhan-HU-1 (NC_045512.2; 29,903 bps), bat SARS-like-CoVZC45 (MG772933.1; 29,802 bps), human SARS-CoV Tor2 (AY274119.3; 29,751 bps), MERS-CoV EMC (NC_019843.3; 30,119 bps), bovine CoV ENT (NC_003045.1; 31,028 bps), and a delta-CoV, the porcine CoV HKU15 (NC_039208.1; 25425 bps) are presented. The genomes consist of a 5′ untranslated region (5′ UTR), an open reading frame (ORF 1a/ab) encoding non-structural proteins (nsps), structural proteins, hemagglutinin–esterase, spike (S), membrane (M), envelope (E), and nucleocapsid (N) proteins, several accessory proteins, and a 3′ untranslated region (3′ UTR). The lengths of the ORFs, nsps, and accessory proteins are not drawn to scale.
